main event: A witness reported seeing a blinking white light in the sky that traveled north and disappeared in a few seconds on August 3, 1969.
interesting points: The observer described the object as moving very fast with a zig-zag motion and larger than a shooting star., The light seemed to emit its own glow rather than reflecting it from the sun., The witness called his wife to confirm the sighting, and they both observed it until it vanished., The case is part of Project Blue Book and is considered well substantiated but remains unidentified., The letter indicates there were several previous sightings in the area with similar characteristics documented.
sighted object: blinking white light in the sky
witness description: The main observer and his wife
